p: Six concentrations (1, 10, 50, 100, 500, and 1,000 µg) of D. kotschyi essential oil were incubated for 30, 90, and 180 min. The trypan blue stain was used to assess the viability of the tachyzoites. The results showed that D. kotschyi has acceptable efficacy in vitro, and the parasiticidal effect of essential oil was significantly better than positive control in all exposure times ( p < .05) (Table 3).
